frameDefinitions: One phenomenon, the Predictive_phenomenon is an indication of the future or current (but still uncertain) existence of another phenomenon, the Future_phenomenon.
The Support, a phenomenon or fact,  lends support to a claim or proposed course of action, the Proposition, where the Domain_of_relevance may also be expressed.
In this frame an Evaluee is described by a (usually implicit)
This frame contains adjectives and nouns that describe the truth or sincerity of communication.
In this frame a Grinder or Grinding_cause causes a Patient to be broken into smaller pieces.
A Winner has victory over an Loser.
frameExamples: The latest poll results <t>show</t> that support of the president is at an all-time low.
That was very <t>righteous</t> of you to help him.
Evelyn was <t>candid</t> with me about the party.
Bill <t>ground</t> the coffee beans into a fine powder.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Predictive_phenomenon</fen> provides evidence for the existence or the nature of the <fen>Outcome</fen> of <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Future_phenomenon</fen> is that phenomenon that is predicted to occur or have a particular quality.
The role <fen>Outcome</fen> identifies those expressions that indicate how the <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen> is expected to turn out based on the evidence of the <fen>Predictive_phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the omen is occuring.
The location where something good or bad might occur.
Support is a fact that lends epistemic support to a claim, or that provides a reason for a course of action. Typically it is expressed as an External Argument.
This is a belief, claim, or proposed course of action to which the Support lends validity. Normally it is expressed as a Finite Clause Complement:
This is the person whose <fen>Behavior</fen> is being judged with respect to its morality.
The assessment of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is based on his or her <fen>Behavior</fen>.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which is the basis of the evaluation of morality.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Message</fen>, the truth or sincerity of which is at issue. It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word, or as the Nominal Head of prenominal uses.

<fen>Message</fen> is the communicative content whose truth or sincerity is at issue. This role does not normally co-occur with the other FEs in this frame. When it does occur, it is normally the External Argument of a predicative use of the <t>Target</t> word, or the modified Nominal Head in a prenominal use.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It often occurs without the <fen>Message</fen> role in predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about'.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that grinds. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic.
The <fen>Grinder</fen> breaks the <fen>Patient</fen> into smaller pieces.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity which undergoes the change brought about by the <fen>Grinder</fen> or <fen>Grinding_cause</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when  the <fen>Grinder</fen> grinds the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where  the <fen>Grinder</fen> grinds the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The individual or individuals who beat the <fen>Loser</fen>.
The individual or individuals that get beat by the <fen>Winner</fen>.
When the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory over the <fen>Loser</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory <fen>Loser</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>To achieve so much this year</fex> augurs well for the future.
This move presages <fex>a freeze on the granting of new concessions</fex>.
It all bodes <fex>well</fex> for the future.
The storm bodes ill for you <fex>here</fex> .
<fex>The fact that you lied to me</fex> shows that I shouldn't trust you.
The fact that you lied to me shows <fex>that I shouldn't trust you</fex>.
It was honorable <fex>of Jackie</fex> to give up the position.
<fex>Accepting that money</fex> was immoral of Lindsay.
His face twisted into an evil <fex>grin</fex>
Evelyn made some candid remarks <fex>in French</fex>.
<fex>The wind</fex> ground the leaves into a fine powder.
